intro: Pedicularis densispica subsp. schneideri, commonly known as the Schneider's lousewort, is a flowering plant native to high-altitude regions of the Himalayas. It belongs to the Orobanchaceae family and is characterized by its erect, hairy stems and showy, tubular flowers that range in color from pink to purple. The plant is hemiparasitic, deriving some of its nutrients from the roots of neighboring plants. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine meadows. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and specialized species.
